title: Header search paths and system headers
description: Implement -I flag for adding include directories. Add default system include paths (/usr/include, /usr/local/include). Search quoted includes in current directory first, then include paths. Search angle-bracket includes only in system paths. Support -isystem for system header paths. Add -nostdinc to disable standard includes. This enables finding standard library headers like stdio.h, stdlib.h, etc.

title: Phase 1: Minimal integer calculator - lexer, parser, codegen for return statements
description: Build minimal compiler that can handle 'int main() { return 42; }'. Includes lexer for integers/operators, recursive descent parser, and x86-64 code generation for single return statement.

title: Implement #error and #warning directives
description:
Add #error and #warning preprocessor directives:

**#error directive:**
- Generates a compilation error with custom message
- Syntax: #error message text
- Used for build-time error checking
- Example: #error "This platform is not supported"

**#warning directive:**
- Generates a compilation warning with custom message
- Syntax: #warning message text
- GCC extension (non-standard but widely used)
- Example: #warning "Using deprecated API"

Common usage patterns:
- Platform/configuration validation
- Deprecation warnings
- Missing required macros

These are commonly used in build systems and library headers.

title: Implement #if/#else/#elif with expressions
description: Support #if constant-expression, #else, and #elif for complex conditional compilation. Implement preprocessor expression evaluator (different from C expression evaluator). Support defined(NAME) operator. Support integer constant expressions with arithmetic and logical operators. Handle #else and #elif branches correctly. This enables feature detection and platform-specific code compilation.

title: Add goto and labels
description: Implement goto statements and labels. Track label definitions and jumps, validate label usage.

title: Phase 4: Pointers and arrays
description: Add pointer types, address-of (&) and dereference (*) operators, array indexing, and pointer arithmetic.

title: Add source context display to error messages
description:
Enhance error messages to show the actual source line with a caret (^) pointing to the error location. Example:

Error at test.c:3:5: Expected Semicolon, got Int
    int y = 20
        ^

This makes errors much easier to understand at a glance. Requires:
- Store source code or read file when displaying errors
- Format error messages to show the line with context
- Add caret indicator at the correct column position
- Handle multi-line context (show surrounding lines)
- Color coding (optional but helpful)
close_reason: Implemented beautiful error messages with source context, line numbers, caret indicators, and color coding. Error display now matches modern compilers.

title: Implement C preprocessor
description: Full C preprocessor with #include, #define, #ifdef/#ifndef, #if/#elif/#else, #undef, macro expansion, stringification, token pasting. Essential for header files and standard library.

title: Implement forward declarations
description: Allow function declarations before definition. Example: 'int foo(int x);' before 'int foo(int x) { return x; }'. Critical for multi-file compilation.
close_reason: Implemented forward declarations. Functions can now be declared with semicolon before definition. Supports mutually recursive functions. All tests passing.

title: Improve error messages with line/column info
description: Add detailed error reporting with line numbers, column positions, source context, and helpful suggestions. Currently errors are just strings.
close_reason: Implemented line/column tracking in lexer and error messages now show location information (e.g., 'at 3:1')

title: Support assignment expressions in parser/codegen
description: Parser currently errors on assignment inside expressions (e.g., (c = 255) < 0). Add assignment to expression grammar and codegen so assignment can be used in comparisons and arithmetic, matching clang's C behavior.

title: ABI: switch int to 32-bit and adjust type sizes
description: Change Type::Int size to 4 bytes, adjust stack alignment, loads/stores, arithmetic, and literal handling to use 32-bit int where appropriate.

title: ABI: adjust struct/array layout rules
description: Match clang layout for structs/arrays in subset: field alignment, padding, array element size, and total struct size/alignment.

title: Test variadic functions with real arguments
description: Create comprehensive tests for variadic functions that actually extract and use variable arguments correctly
close_reason: All variadic function implementation complete. va_start initializes va_list structure with register save area, va_arg extracts arguments per System V AMD64 ABI, prologue/epilogue saves all argument registers, and tests verify correct behavior with real arguments.

title: Add C standard library support
description: Provide C standard library header files and test integration with glibc. We don't need to implement the functions - just provide declarations and ensure proper linking with the system's glibc.
close_reason: Stdlib support complete via glibc linking. Variadic functions enable calling printf, malloc, strlen, etc. Created comprehensive integration tests. No need to implement stdlib functions - just link against system glibc.

title: Code generation optimization
description:
Improve code generation quality and add optimizations:
- Register allocation (currently stack-heavy)
- Constant folding and propagation
- Dead code elimination
- Common subexpression elimination
- Peephole optimizations
- Better use of x86-64 addressing modes
- Reduce unnecessary push/pop operations
- Optimize function prologue/epilogue
- Tail call optimization
- Loop optimizations (strength reduction, invariant code motion)
- Optimization levels (-O0, -O1, -O2, -O3)

Better codegen improves performance and reduces binary size.

title: Inline functions and function specifiers
description:
Support inline functions and function specifiers:
- inline keyword for function inlining
- static inline for header-only functions (very common in C)
- extern inline semantics
- _Noreturn specifier (C11) or __attribute__((noreturn))
- __attribute__((always_inline)) and related GCC attributes
- Proper linkage rules for inline functions

Inline functions are ubiquitous in C headers and are essential for real-world code.

title: Add tests for advanced macro features (##, #, __VA_ARGS__, #undef)
description:
Create comprehensive tests for already-implemented but untested macro features:

**Token pasting (##):**
- Concatenate tokens in macro expansion
- Example: #define CONCAT(a,b) a##b → CONCAT(x,y) becomes xy
- Test with identifiers, numbers, operators

**Stringification (#):**
- Convert macro argument to string literal
- Example: #define STR(x) #x → STR(foo) becomes "foo"
- Test with identifiers, expressions, whitespace

**Variadic macros (__VA_ARGS__):**
- Macros with variable number of arguments
- Example: #define LOG(fmt, ...) printf(fmt, __VA_ARGS__)
- Test with 0, 1, and multiple variadic args

**#undef directive:**
- Undefine previously defined macros
- Test macro replacement after #undef
- Test #ifdef after #undef

These features are implemented in preprocessor.rs but have no test coverage.

title: Add static storage class
description: Implement static for file-scope and function-scope variables. Static locals persist across calls, static globals have internal linkage.

title: Phase 6.5: Enums
description: Add enum support (parsing, typing, codegen) with tests and clang-comparison integration coverage.

title: Tokenize enum keyword and constants
description: Add lexer support for enum keyword and reuse identifiers/int literals for enumerators.

title: Parse enum definitions and enumerators
description: Parse enum declarations/definitions (named and anonymous) and enumerator values, and store in AST/symbol tables.

title: Typecheck enums and size rules
description: Add enum type representation and ensure enums behave like ints for size/alignment and in expressions.

title: Codegen enum constants and variables
description: Emit enum constants as integer literals; handle enum-typed vars in codegen and initializers.

title: Integration tests for enums
description: Add tests/files for enum definitions, values, and expression use; compare cc2 vs clang outputs and update snapshots.

title: Support >6 function parameters
description: Implement stack-based parameter passing for functions with more than 6 parameters. Parameters 7+ go on stack per System V ABI.

title: Add function pointer support
description: Implement function pointers. Example: 'int (*fp)(int, int) = &add;'. Requires: function pointer types, indirect calls, assignments.

title: Add do-while loops
description: Implement do-while loops (condition checked after body). Syntax: 'do { ... } while (condition);'
close_reason: Implemented do-while loops with full integration test coverage. Syntax: do { ... } while (condition); All tests passing.

title: Phase 5: Tokenize struct keywords and operators
description: Add lexer support for 'struct' keyword and '.'/ '->' operators.

title: Add unsigned char/short/long types
description: Add unsigned char, unsigned short, and unsigned long types with correct size/alignment, codegen, promotions, and tests.

title: Update calling convention for float parameters
Add inline assembly support
description: Support inline assembly with asm() or __asm__. Useful for system programming and optimizations. Not required for C compliance but useful.

title: Phase 0: Project setup and basic infrastructure
Integration tests: expand C subset coverage
description: Add many tests under tests/files for supported subset (control flow, pointers, arrays, structs, sizeof), with snapshots and clang comparison parity.

title: Phase 2: Variables and function calls
description: Add support for local variables, function definitions, and function calls. Implement stack frame management and calling conventions.

title: Phase 6.6: Unions
description: Add union support (parsing, layout, codegen) with tests and clang-comparison integration coverage.

title: Tokenize union keyword
description: Add lexer support for union keyword.

title: Parse union definitions and member access
description: Parse union definitions and reuse member access syntax; store union layouts alongside structs.

title: Union layout and size rules
description: Compute union size/alignment as max of members and align accordingly; ensure sizeof/offset behavior matches clang.

title: Codegen union loads/stores
description: Handle union member access in codegen by using the union base address and member type for loads/stores.

title: Integration tests for unions
description: Add tests/files for union layout, member access, and initializers; compare cc2 vs clang outputs and update snapshots.

title: C89 (ANSI C) standards compliance
description: Achieve full compliance with the C89/C90 (ANSI C) standard. This is the foundation standard that all C compilers must support. Includes: all basic data types (char, int, short, long, float, double), storage classes (auto, register, static, extern), control flow (if, for, while, do-while, switch, break, continue, goto), functions and function pointers, pointers and arrays, structs and unions, typedef, enums, bitfields, const and volatile qualifiers, preprocessor directives, standard library headers, and all operators. This epic tracks systematic verification and completion of all C89 features.

title: Implement struct bit-fields
description: Add support for bit-fields in structs. Syntax: struct { int field : 3; unsigned flag : 1; }. Bit-fields allow packing multiple small integers into a single storage unit. Required for C89 compliance. Common in hardware register definitions, protocol headers, and memory-constrained code. Implementation needs to handle: bit-field width constraints, alignment, storage unit allocation, signed vs unsigned bit-fields, and bit-field access in expressions.

title: Add <assert.h> standard header
description: Provide assert.h header with assert macro. Syntax: assert(expression). If expression is false (0), prints diagnostic and calls abort(). Can be disabled with NDEBUG. Critical for debugging and development. Implementation: create header with assert macro that checks condition, prints __FILE__ and __LINE__, and aborts. Honor NDEBUG to disable in production builds.
close_reason: Implemented assert.h with assert macro for debugging

title: Expand <stdio.h> standard library support
description: Expand stdio.h to include all C89 required functions beyond printf. Required: FILE type, fopen, fclose, fread, fwrite, fseek, ftell, rewind, fgetc, fputc, fgets, fputs, getchar, putchar, gets, puts, scanf, fscanf, sscanf, fprintf, sprintf, perror, feof, ferror, clearerr, remove, rename, tmpfile, tmpnam, setbuf, setvbuf. Currently only printf is tested. Implementation: create comprehensive header, link to or implement functions.

title: Expand <stdlib.h> standard library support
description: Expand stdlib.h to include all C89 required functions. Currently tested: malloc, calloc, memcpy, memset. Need to add: free, realloc, abort, exit, atexit, getenv, system, bsearch, qsort, abs, labs, div, ldiv, atoi, atof, atol, strtod, strtol, strtoul, rand, srand, mblen, mbtowc, wctomb, mbstowcs, wcstombs. Also need EXIT_SUCCESS, EXIT_FAILURE, RAND_MAX macros. Implementation: comprehensive header with all declarations.

title: Expand <string.h> standard library support
description: Expand string.h to include all C89 required functions. Currently partially tested. Need: strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strcmp, strncmp, strchr, strrchr, strspn, strcspn, strpbrk, strstr, strlen, strerror, strtok, memchr, memcmp (in addition to existing memcpy, memset). Essential for all string manipulation. Implementation: create comprehensive header with declarations, link to or implement functions.

title: Add <time.h> standard header
description: Provide time.h header with time and date functions. Required: time_t, clock_t, struct tm types. Functions: clock, time, difftime, mktime, asctime, ctime, gmtime, localtime, strftime. Macros: CLOCKS_PER_SEC. Used for timing, date/time formatting, and time calculations. Implementation: create header, link to system time functions or provide basic implementations.

title: Add <setjmp.h> standard header
description: Provide setjmp.h header for non-local jumps. Required: jmp_buf type, setjmp macro, longjmp function. Allows jumping out of deeply nested function calls for error handling. Similar to exception handling in modern languages. Implementation: create header with jmp_buf (typically array to save registers/stack), setjmp saves context and returns 0, longjmp restores context and returns to setjmp with non-zero value. Platform-specific assembly may be required.

title: Add <signal.h> standard header
description: Provide signal.h header for signal handling. Required: sig_atomic_t type, signal function, raise function. Signals: SIGABRT, SIGFPE, SIGILL, SIGINT, SIGSEGV, SIGTERM. Handler values: SIG_DFL, SIG_IGN, SIG_ERR. Allows programs to handle asynchronous events like ctrl-C, arithmetic errors, segfaults. Implementation: create header with declarations, may link to system signal functions. Lower priority as not commonly needed in simple programs.

title: Add <locale.h> standard header
description: Provide locale.h header for localization support. Required: struct lconv, setlocale, localeconv functions. Categories: LC_ALL, LC_COLLATE, LC_CTYPE, LC_MONETARY, LC_NUMERIC, LC_TIME. Controls locale-specific behavior like number formatting, date formats, character classification. Implementation: create header with minimal C locale support. Full locale support is complex and may be deferred. Lower priority as most programs use C locale.

title: Add <errno.h> standard header
description: Provide errno.h header for error reporting. Required: errno macro (expands to modifiable lvalue of type int). Error codes: EDOM (domain error for math functions), ERANGE (range error for math functions), and potentially others. Used by standard library functions to report errors. Implementation: create header with errno declaration (typically extern int errno or thread-local), define error code macros. Essential for robust error handling.

title: Add incomplete type support
description: Support incomplete types in C89. Incomplete types: forward-declared structs/unions (struct foo;), arrays of unknown size (extern int arr[];), void type. Uses: allow mutually-referential structs, declare arrays with size determined later, opaque types in APIs. Implementation: parser must accept forward declarations, type checker must allow pointers to incomplete types but not sizeof or member access, linker must resolve array sizes. Essential for modular code design.

title: Add register storage class support
description: Implement the register storage class specifier. Syntax: register int x;. Suggests to compiler that variable should be stored in register for fast access. In C89, register variables cannot have their address taken with &. Modern compilers often ignore register hints, but proper parsing and semantic checking is required for C89 compliance. Implementation: parse register keyword, prevent address-of operator on register variables, treat as optimization hint.

title: Verify integer constant suffix support (L, U, UL)
description: Verify and test integer constant suffixes: L or l for long, U or u for unsigned, UL/ul/LU/lu for unsigned long. Examples: 42L (long), 42U (unsigned), 42UL (unsigned long). These suffixes control the type of integer constants. May already be supported but needs explicit test coverage. Create test file with various suffix combinations and verify correct type inference and value handling.

title: Verify floating-point constant suffix support (F, L)
description: Verify and test floating-point constant suffixes: F or f for float, L or l for long double. Examples: 3.14F (float), 3.14L (long double), 3.14 (double by default). These control the type of floating-point constants. May already be supported but needs explicit test coverage. Create test file verifying suffix parsing and type inference.

title: Add unary plus operator support
description: Implement unary plus operator (+x). C89 requires unary plus for symmetry with unary minus. Effect: performs integer promotion on operand (char/short promoted to int) but doesn't change value. Example: +x is valid even though it seems redundant. Rarely used but required for standard compliance. Implementation: parse unary plus in expression parser, apply integer promotion rules, generate appropriate code.

title: Verify auto storage class (implicit by default)
description: Verify that auto storage class works correctly (though rarely used explicitly as it's the default). Local variables are auto by default. Explicit syntax: auto int x;. Needs basic test to verify parser accepts auto keyword and treats it same as omitting storage class. Very low priority as auto is almost never written explicitly in practice.

title: Implement integer and floating-point literal suffixes (U, L, F)
description: Add support for C89 literal suffixes: U/u for unsigned, L/l for long (integers and long double), F/f for float, combined UL/ul/LU/lu for unsigned long. Examples: 42U (unsigned int), 42L (long), 42UL (unsigned long), 3.14F (float), 3.14L (long double). Required for proper type inference of constants and correct limits.h/float.h header values. Implementation: extend lexer to recognize suffixes, determine appropriate type based on suffix combination, handle case-insensitive variants.
close_reason: Implemented integer and floating-point literal suffixes (U, L, F, UL, etc.)

title: Support string literal concatenation
description: Implement adjacent string literal concatenation. C89 requires that adjacent string literals be concatenated: "hello" "world" becomes "helloworld". This happens during preprocessing/tokenization phase. Also applies to wide strings: L"a" L"b" becomes L"ab". Mixed narrow and wide strings are undefined in C89. Use cases: splitting long strings across lines, macro-generated strings. Implementation: concatenate adjacent string tokens during lexing or parsing phase.

title: Implement wide character and string literals
description: Add support for wide character and string literals. Syntax: L'x' for wide character constant, L"string" for wide string literal. Type wchar_t defined in stddef.h. Wide characters support internationalization and Unicode. C89 requires implementation-defined encoding (often UTF-32 or UTF-16). Implementation needs: L prefix parsing, wchar_t type, wide string storage, wide character arithmetic. Note: actual wide character support may be limited without full locale support.

title: Support K&R style function declarations
description: Add support for old-style (K&R) function declarations and definitions. Syntax: int func(a, b) int a; char b; { return a + b; }. This is the original C function syntax before prototypes. C89 allows both K&R style and prototype style. Implementation: parse parameter name list separately from parameter declarations, handle type defaulting (unspecified parameters default to int), support both calling conventions. Note: deprecated but required for C89 compliance and legacy code.

title: Add <limits.h> standard header
description: Provide limits.h header with implementation limits. Required macros: CHAR_BIT, CHAR_MIN, CHAR_MAX, SCHAR_MIN, SCHAR_MAX, UCHAR_MAX, SHRT_MIN, SHRT_MAX, USHRT_MAX, INT_MIN, INT_MAX, UINT_MAX, LONG_MIN, LONG_MAX, ULONG_MAX. These define the ranges of integer types. Implementation: create header file with appropriate values for target architecture (likely x86-64). Values must match actual type sizes in compiler.
close_reason: Implemented limits.h with all required C89 macros for integer type limits

title: Add <float.h> standard header
description: Provide float.h header with floating-point characteristics. Required macros: FLT_RADIX, FLT_MANT_DIG, DBL_MANT_DIG, FLT_DIG, DBL_DIG, FLT_MIN_EXP, DBL_MIN_EXP, FLT_MAX_EXP, DBL_MAX_EXP, FLT_MIN, FLT_MAX, DBL_MIN, DBL_MAX, FLT_EPSILON, DBL_EPSILON. These define floating-point precision and range. Implementation: create header with values matching IEEE 754 standard (used on x86-64).
close_reason: Implemented float.h with all required C89 macros for floating-point characteristics

title: Add <math.h> standard header
description: Provide math.h header with mathematical functions. Required functions: sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan, atan2, sinh, cosh, tanh, exp, log, log10, pow, sqrt, ceil, floor, fabs, ldexp, frexp, modf, fmod. Also required: HUGE_VAL macro. Implementation: create header with function declarations, may link against system libm or implement subset. Essential for scientific and engineering applications.

title: Add <ctype.h> standard header
description: Provide ctype.h header with character classification and conversion functions. Required functions: isalnum, isalpha, iscntrl, isdigit, isgraph, islower, isprint, ispunct, isspace, isupper, isxdigit, tolower, toupper. These are fundamental for text processing, parsing, and validation. Implementation: create header file with function declarations or macros, implement or link to standard library.

title: Add failing integration tests for assignment truncation/promotion
description: Add tests in tests/files that compare cc2 vs clang for assignment expressions to smaller integer types (char/short/unsigned variants), covering truncation and sign/zero extension expectations.

title: Add unsigned int type
description: Introduce unsigned int in AST/type system, parser, codegen, and tests; ensure correct zero-extension and comparisons.

title: Compiler ABI compliance with clang subset
description: Align cc2 data model/ABI with clang for supported subset (e.g., int=32-bit) so integration tests can compare outputs.

title: Add explicit type casting
description: Implement explicit casts: '(int)x', '(long*)ptr'. Handle pointer/integer conversions, truncation, sign extension.

title: Improve error reporting and diagnostics
description:
Enhance compiler error messages and diagnostics:
- Show file name, line number, and column for all errors
- Multi-error reporting (don't stop at first error)
- Warning system with warning levels (-Wall, -Wextra, -Werror)
- Common warnings: unused variables, implicit conversions, uninitialized variables
- Suggestions and hints in error messages
- Color-coded output (errors in red, warnings in yellow)
- Caret diagnostics showing exact error location in source
- Note system for additional context
- Error recovery to continue parsing after errors

Good error messages are critical for developer experience.

title: Add pointer type system to AST and types
Preprocessor integration tests
description: Create comprehensive tests for preprocessor features. Test #include with various file paths. Test #define object-like and function-like macros. Test conditional compilation (#ifdef, #ifndef, #if, #else, #elif). Test macro expansion edge cases (recursive macros, stringification, token pasting). Test multi-file compilation. Test include guards. Compare preprocessed output with GCC -E. Add test files to tests/files/preprocessor/.

title: Implement C preprocessor directives
description:
Add full preprocessor support to handle real C code:
- #include directive (header files)
- #define macros (object-like and function-like)
- Conditional compilation (#ifdef, #ifndef, #if, #else, #elif, #endif)
- #undef
- Predefined macros (__FILE__, __LINE__, __DATE__, __TIME__, __STDC__, etc.)
- #pragma directives
- #error and #warning
- Line continuation with backslash
- Macro expansion with stringification (#) and token pasting (##)

This is critical for compiling real-world C programs that use headers and macros extensively.

title: Add const and volatile qualifiers
description: Implement const and volatile type qualifiers. Track qualifiers in type system, enforce const correctness in assignments.

title: Add float literal support to lexer and parser
Add multi-file compilation and linking
description: Support compiling multiple .c files and linking .o files. Requires extern declarations, header file support, linker integration.

title: Implement #include directive
description: Support #include "file.h" and #include <file.h> directives. Implement file search logic with include paths (-I flag). Handle recursive includes with cycle detection. Support both quoted includes (local directory) and angle-bracket includes (system paths). Read included file and insert its preprocessed content at the #include location.

title: Add typedef support
description: Implement typedef for type aliases. Example: 'typedef unsigned long size_t;'. Requires type resolution in parser/symbol table.

title: Add array types and indexing syntax
Implement #ifdef/#ifndef/#endif
description: Support conditional compilation with #ifdef NAME, #ifndef NAME, and #endif. Check if macro is defined/undefined in preprocessor symbol table. Skip code blocks when condition is false. Support nested conditionals with proper tracking. This enables include guards pattern (#ifndef HEADER_H / #define HEADER_H / ... / #endif).

title: Add tests for pointers and arrays
Add -D flag for command-line macro definitions
description:
Implement -D command-line flag to define macros from the command line:
- Support -DNAME (define macro with empty value)
- Support -DNAME=value (define macro with value)
- Support multiple -D flags
- Integrate with preprocessor macro table

This is essential for conditional compilation and build system integration.
Very commonly used in real-world C projects.

Examples:
  cc2 -DDEBUG -DVERSION=2 test.c
  cc2 -D_GNU_SOURCE -D__x86_64__ program.c

title: Phase 8: Preprocessor Support
description: Add preprocessor support to cc2 compiler, enabling #include, #define macros, conditional compilation (#ifdef, #ifndef, #if, #else, #elif, #endif), and multi-file compilation. This is essential for compiling real C programs that use headers and the standard library.

title: Add string literal support
description: Implement string literals ("hello world"). Requires: lexer updates for string tokenization, AST node for string literals, codegen for .rodata section, escape sequence handling
close_reason: Implemented string literal expressions with .rodata section support. All tests passing.

title: Preprocessor lexer and infrastructure
description: Add preprocessor token recognition to lexer. Recognize # as directive start, and preprocessor keywords (include, define, ifdef, ifndef, endif, if, else, elif, undef, pragma, etc.). Create src/preprocessor.rs module with basic preprocessor infrastructure. The preprocessor should run before parsing, transforming source text into preprocessed text.

title: Advanced initialization features
description:
Implement advanced C initialization features:
- Compound literals: (struct Point){.x = 10, .y = 20}
- More complex designated initializers (nested structs, mixed with positional)
- String literal initialization of char arrays
- Flexible initialization of unions
- Static initialization of complex types
- Brace elision rules
- Zero-initialization semantics

These features are commonly used in modern C code and are part of C99/C11 standards.

title: Implement #line directive for line number control
description: Add support for the line directive to control line numbers and filenames in error messages. Syntax: line 100 or line 100 filename.c. This directive changes the values reported by FILE and LINE macros. Use cases: code generators that emit C code want errors to refer to original source, preprocessed code debugging, generated code attribution. Example: line 50 original.txt makes errors reference original.txt instead of generated file. Lower priority but useful for tool integration.
close_reason: Implemented #line directive for line number control

title: Support C and C++ style comments in lexer
description:
Comments are currently only removed by the preprocessor, but the lexer should handle them directly for:
1. Better error messages (line numbers more accurate)
2. Support for preprocessed code that still has comments
3. Consistency with standard C compilers

Need to add:
- Single-line comments: // ... (to end of line)
- Multi-line comments: /* ... */ (can span lines)

Currently the preprocessor strips these out as a workaround, but proper lexer support is needed.
close_reason: Implemented C-style (/* */) and C++-style (//) comment support in the lexer with proper error handling for unterminated comments. All 4 test cases pass.

title: Add void type
description: Implement void type for functions with no return value and void* for generic pointers. Example: 'void foo() { }', 'void* ptr;'

title: Phase 6: Preprocessor and multi-file compilation
description: Add preprocessor (#include, #define, conditional compilation), linking multiple object files, and basic standard library support.
close_reason: Preprocessor fully implemented and tested. 9/10 tests passing (complex_macros requires ternary operator support in lexer). Multi-file compilation and linking already working from Phase 5.

title: Test variadic functions with va_* macros
Advanced language features and extensions
description:
Implement additional language features and useful GCC/Clang extensions:

GCC/Clang extensions (widely used):
- Statement expressions: ({ int x = 5; x * 2; })
- typeof operator
- __builtin functions (__builtin_expect, __builtin_unreachable, etc.)
- Computed goto (labels as values)
- Case ranges in switch: case 1 ... 10:
- Binary constants: 0b1010
- __attribute__ extensions beyond basic ones
- Nested functions (GCC extension)

Other useful features:
- Better inline assembly support (extended asm with constraints)
- #pragma once (common non-standard preprocessor directive)
- Designated initializers for arrays with ranges
- Zero-length arrays (common GCC extension)

These extensions are widely used in real-world C code, especially in Linux kernel and systems programming.

title: Implement full va_arg with argument extraction
description: Implement proper va_arg that extracts arguments from va_list by reading from register save area or overflow area based on type and current offsets
close_reason: All variadic function implementation complete. va_start initializes va_list structure with register save area, va_arg extracts arguments per System V AMD64 ABI, prologue/epilogue saves all argument registers, and tests verify correct behavior with real arguments.

title: Add global variable support
description: Support global variables in .data and .bss sections. Requires: global symbol tracking, initialization, proper section generation in codegen.
close_reason: Implemented global variables with .data and .bss sections. All tests passing.

title: Phase 5: Parse structs and member access
description: Extend parser/AST/types for struct declarations, struct literals, and member access ('.' and '->').

title: Complete floating point and numeric support
description:
Improve floating point and numeric type support:

Floating point:
- Float literal suffixes (f, F, l, L)
- Hexadecimal floating point literals (0x1.8p3)

title: Add variadic function support
description: Implement variadic functions (printf-style). Requires: va_list, va_start, va_arg, va_end support, variable argument passing on stack.

title: Implement predefined macros (__FILE__, __LINE__, etc.)
description:
Add standard predefined preprocessor macros required by C standards:

**Required by C standard:**
- __FILE__ - Current file name as string literal
- __LINE__ - Current line number as integer
- __DATE__ - Compilation date as "Mmm dd yyyy"
- __TIME__ - Compilation time as "hh:mm:ss"
- __STDC__ - Defined as 1 for conforming implementations
- __STDC_VERSION__ - C standard version (199901L for C99, 201112L for C11)
- __func__ - Current function name (C99)

**Common extensions:**
- __COUNTER__ - Increments each time it's used
- __INCLUDE_LEVEL__ - Nesting depth of includes
- __BASE_FILE__ - Name of the main file being compiled

These macros are essential for debugging, logging, and conditional compilation.
Widely used in real-world code for error messages and assertions.

C17 features (mostly bug fixes, but verify compliance)

Track compliance with test suites and standards documents.

description: Assignment expressions currently leave the RHS value in %rax without truncation/extension, so an assignment like (char x = 255) used in an expression can compare as 255 instead of -1. Implement #pragma once for include guards
description: Add support for pragma once directive as alternative to traditional include guards. This is a non-standard but widely supported extension. Syntax is simply: pragma once at top of header file. Implementation: track files that have been included with pragma once and skip re-including them. Benefits: simpler than ifdef guards, faster compilation, prevents typos. Widely used in modern C code and supported by all major compilers including GCC, Clang, MSVC.

title: Compiler tooling and developer experience
description:
Improve compiler as a tool and developer experience:

Compilation modes:
- -c flag: compile to object files without linking
- -S flag: stop after assembly generation
- -E flag: preprocessor only mode
- -M flags: generate dependency files for makefiles
- Support for multiple input files
- Linking multiple object files together

Debugging support:
- Generate DWARF debug information (-g flag)
- Support for debug symbols
- Source maps for debugging

Build integration:
- Compatible command-line interface with gcc/clang
- Proper exit codes for build systems
- Support common compiler flags (-I, -L, -l, -D, etc.)
- Response file support (@file)
- Colored diagnostics control

Output options:
- Multiple output formats (ELF, assembly, object)
- Position-independent code (-fPIC)
- Shared library support (-shared)
- Static vs dynamic linking control

This makes cc2 usable as a drop-in replacement in real build systems.
